alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Jackson; Lee; Owsley; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Owsley, east central Jackson, southwestern Breathitt, southern Lee and southern Wolfe Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vincent, or near Booneville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pebworth and Scoville around 630 PM EDT. Booneville, Levi, Turin, Corgleton, White Ash, Proctor, Belle Point, Major and Southfork around 635 PM EDT. Beattyville, Stay, Lower Buffalo, Enoch, Chestnut Gap, Eversole and Maloney around 640 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Grass, Lerose, St. Helens, Cowcreek, Airedale, Arnett, Lone, Athol, Tallega, Canyon Falls, Monica, Primrose, Vada, Copebranch, Jetts Creek, Turkey, Fillmore, Houston, Williba, Chenowee, Oakdale, Guerrant, Yeadon, Gentry, War Creek, Lawson, Widecreek, Pence and Canoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
